analysis.Summary: A Vue 3 component that renders a horizontally scrollable list of dates, allows the user to select or reset a date, highlights the base date when no selection is made, and emits the selected date back to the parent.
analysis.Purpose: Provide a reusable date-picker UI element in the project, letting consumers display a range of dates, pick one, and automatically scroll the list to center the selected or default date.

Components.name: DatePicker
responsibilities: Render a horizontal scroller of date items
Emit events when the user selects or clears a date
Automatically scroll the selected or default date into view

Functions.name: selectDate
Functions.description: Handles click on a date item: toggles selection, resets on re-click, formats and emits the new date.

Functions.name: isHighlighted
Functions.description: Returns true if no date is selected and the given date equals the base date (today).

Functions.name: formatDateForRouter
Functions.description: Formats a Date object into a string 'DDMMYYYY' for router or API usage.

Functions.name: dayLetter
Functions.description: Produces the narrow weekday label (one letter) in uppercase according to the locale prop.

Functions.name: generateDates
Functions.description: Generates an array of consecutive Date objects starting from `start` up to a given count, optionally offset by `options.dateStart`.

analysis.Usage: Imported as `import DatePicker from 'components/DatePicker/DatePicker.vue'`. In parent templates it is used with props `:date`, `:options`, `:locale` and listens for `@update:date` to get the selected date.
Notes: There is no <style> block in the file; it relies entirely on global/CSS utility classes.
generateDates' for-loop condition uses `|| 0` which may not behave as intended due to operator precedenceâ€”review the count and offset logic.
The onMounted hook auto-scrolls the highlighted/selected date into the center of the scroller.
Props: `date` expected as 'DDMMYYYY' string, `options` may contain `dateStart` and `dateEnd` to control the date range, `locale` controls weekday labels.
